Migrant #Hakka people developed martial arts to secure the life in the violent social environment of southern China from late Ming to early Qing.
 
They had to wield arms to secure their life in the turbulent years.

Due to state prohibition on private weapons, they adapted everyday tools such as Daai Paa, Baan Dang and Co Tau. 

Since the beginning of the twentieth century, Hakka people focused more on empty-hand techniques, more concerned to day with leisure and health.

City University of Hong Kong created the legacy using multi-media technologies, through Feb 28.

Source: City University of Hong Kong & Hakka Kung Fu Culture Research Society #CityU #CreativeMedia #HakkaCulture #martialarts

Baby primate #Vena is the latest Bornean #orangutan to be rescued in #Indonesia after being kept as a pet. 

Villagers on the Indonesian side of jungle-clad Borneo island often keep the critically endangered apes as pets even though the practice is illegal.

Vena is now being cared for at a centre run by NGO International Animal Rescue, whose staff ensure she stays clean and feed her bottles of milk mixed with vitamin supplements.

After being rescued, young apes are sent to a "jungle school", where they spend years learning to fend for themselves before being released into the wild.
link_name: Baby orangutan rescued after being kept as a pet

Mo Naga made his own 100 percent natural ink, with using modern tools at the same time, he creates both tradition and new patterns for the tattoos.

Villagers in eastern #China have a unique way of washing away the taint of evil spirits, by bathing in a shower of scorching #sparks.

The ritual takes place in the city of #Putian in #Fujian province.

With eyes closed, they lean their faces into fireworks that spit out white sparks, which has given the ceremony its local name, "eating flowers".

Some of them twist and turn to expose more of their bodies to burn away the evil.

It's part of extended celebrations for the annual #Lantern #Festival by the Chinese #Hakka people.
link_name: Struggle against evil sparks China ritual

status_message:
Thousands of #Mongolian herders face disastrous livestock losses from severe weather known as the "#dzud".

"Dzud" means a dry summer followed by bitter winter cold, which leaves #livestock and other #animals at risk of starvation and exposure on the country's rugged steppes.

It threatens tens of thousands of #herders in a country where almost half the population depends entirely on livestock for food, transportation and income.

More than 157,000 people are "at risk" across 17 of Mongolia's 21 provinces.

The Red Cross hopes to raise enough to assist 11,000 of the hardest-hit households, including provision of cash grants, first-aid kits, and funds to help communities prepare for future dzuds.

Bao Bao's dumping party:

The Chinese embassy in Washington and the Smithsonian's National Zoo throw a dumpling (jiaozi) party on Thursday morning for giant panda Bao Bao in front of her yard. Many giant panda fans also wrote their best wishes for Bao Bao on wish cards on a desk. Bao Bao also receive a food box with dumpling sign outside. In China, dumplings are a must-have food for festivities and a popular food for bidding farewell to loved ones before they leave home. Bao Bao, born at the zoo on Aug 23, 2013, will leave for China on Feb 21. (Chen Weihua/China Daily)

An exhibition of tomb treasures recently unearthed in China's Jiangsu province will be presented at the Asian Art Museum in San Francisco from Feb 17 to May 28, revealing how the Western Han Dynasty (206 BC-AD 24) courts sought to glorify their stature in this life and the next one through rare artwork and artifacts. The exhibition, titled Tomb Treasures: New Discoveries from China's Han Dynasty, will showcase more than 160 artifacts made of ceramic, lacquer, precious metal and priceless jade. (Lia Zhu)
link_name: Artifacts bringing ancient China to life

status_message:
#India successfully put a record 104 #satellites from a single #rocket into orbit on Wednesday.

The rocket took off at 9:28am and cruised at a speed of 27,000 km per hour, ejecting all the 104 satellites into orbit in around 30 minutes.

The rocket's main cargo was a 714 kg satellite for Earth observation but it was also loaded with 103 smaller "nano satellites", weighing a combined 664 kilograms. The smallest weighed only 1.1 kilograms.

Nearly all of the nano satellites are from other countries, including Israel, Kazakhstan, Switzerland and 96 from the United States.

Only three satellites belonged to India.
link_name: India puts record 104 satellites into orbit

status_message:
Everything about Bao Bao:

Giant panda keepers and biologists at the Smithsonian's National Zoo were surrounded by journalists early Wednesday afternoon to answer questions about giant panda and especially Bao Bao, who is leaving for China on Feb 21. Michael Brown-Palsgrove, curator of giant panda at the zoo, said Bao Bao is adapting well in preparing for the long trip. Bao Bao was eating bamboo and playing in the sunshine in the yard on Wednesday afternoon, in front of dozens of a large crowd of visitors, mostly journalists. It was part of a series of 10-day events to bid farewell to Bao Bao. Under the loan agreement between the zoo and China, giant pandas born outside China also belong to China and should return to China by the age of 4. Bao Bao will turn 4 on August 23.  (Chen Weihua/China Daily)

Michigan governor invites Chinese tourists and investors: Come to Michigan!

"Come to Michigan!" That was the invitation offered to Chinese tourists and investors from Michigan Governor Rick Snyder during an exclusive interview with China Daily in Detroit on Saturday. Snyder discussed topics of Chinese investment in the residential sector, two-way investment and cooperation between Michigan and Chinese counterparts and the promotion of the "pure Michigan" tourism program in China, believing that more Chinese tourists will come to Michigan to experience the "real America". Snyder, a Republican, has visited China six times since he was sworn into office as the state's 48th governor. Two-way investment between Michigan and Chinese companies has been on the rise, with GM and Ford gaining significant market share in China, while the number of Chinese-invested companies surpassed 80 by the end of last year. ZHANG YU'AN / CHINA DAILY
link_name: Michigan governor invites Chinese tourists and investors: Come...

Beating a #rock #statue of #Buddha to wish for a good new year and an abundant #harvest, villagers in China's eastern #Fujian province have a unique way of worshipping the deity.

Villagers in Yuxi village wrapped the centuries-old rock Buddha, in red cloth and rinsed it with water, before tightly tying it to a wooden palanquin.

Four men who had been on a strictly vegetarian diet for three days attempted to carry it across a nearby river, while another team of more than a dozen tried to stop them by blocking them with bamboo sticks. 

The stone represents a local #god capable of defending the village against both drought and flood.
link_name: China villagers 'beat the Buddha' for a good harvest

Dog tries to have its day
 
The prospect of competing in the Olympics of dog shows lured Cui Nian of Hangzhou to the Westminster Dog Show on Monday in New York. Cui and his 3-year-old female toy poodle named "Oolong Tea" were competing in the Toy group, one of seven different groups at Westminster. The others are Sporting, Hound, Working, Terrier, Non-Sporting and Herding. Cui and "Oolong Tea" didn't advance beyond Monday's competition. "I came to this show because it's a world-famous event, like the Olympic Games," Cui said. "It's an honor for us to be here. I traveled a long way from China with my dog on the plane. She was in the passenger cabin with me." PAUL WELITZKIN / CHINA DAILY
link_name: Chinese are proud to compete in NY dog show

A former #Chinese #soldier who was unable to leave India for 54 years flew home to China over the weekend.

Wang Qi, now in his 70s, was an army engineer when he went missing in a forest on the China-India border in 1963. 

He was later detained by the Indian military and imprisoned for seven years on an #espionage charge.

He lived in a remote village in #India since he was released from prison. For decades, his efforts to leave the country were rejected by the authorities because he had no official proof of identity. 

However, after diplomatic efforts, on Thursday, the Indian government granted the veteran permission to leave and re-enter the country at any time.
link_name: Soldier returns home after 54 years in India

status_message: Debbie Stabenow, senior US senator from Michigan, congratulates Chinese New Year to more than 500 Chinese and American guests attending the Chinese New Year Gala in Detroit Saturday evening. Senator Stabenow spoke in Chinese "Happy New Year" to the guests. (Zhang Yu'an)

Consul general in Chicago encourages enhanced China-US cultural exchange     
 
Hong Lei, China's consul general in Chicago, visited the Detroit Institute of Arts (DIA) and the Chinese New Year celebration calligraphy and painting exhibition on Sunday. DIA Director and President Salvador Salort-Pons guided the Chinese envoy and other Chinese and US guests to some of the exhibition halls. The director specifically introduced to Hong a Chinese bronze relic "Hu" dated to the Eastern Zhou Dynasty. He expressed his hope that the DIA would have a special hall exhibiting Chinese art in the future. Hong encouraged DIA to strengthen exchange and cooperation with Chinese counterparts, pledging that he himself would like to help in that area. Hong said cultural exchange should go hand in hand with economic cooperation between the two countries. status_message: In Salem, a city that represents a dark period in US history, sits Yin Yu Tang, believed to be the first antique Chinese house to be dismantled and re-erected in the United States. Enter the Yin Yu Tang, a 7-minute walk away, and you will be in a stately 16-bedroom wooden house built during the Qing Dynasty (1644-1911) by a prosperous merchant surnamed Huang. The 200-year-old Huang house – brought to the US from China in 2003 and re-erected at the Peabody Essex Museum (PEM) – offers a perspective on Chinese art, architecture and culture.
link_name: A Chinese relic finds a new home in US

The #Malaysian indigenous Mah Meri community, believed to be descendants of seafaring people, celebrated their 'Puja Pantai' #ritual on Wednesday.

#China's #transportation system is now preparing for another travel peak as #Spring #Festival draws to a close.

A ten-year-old rural #Bangladeshi girl with bark-like warts on her face could be the first female ever diagnosed with "tree man syndrome".

Less than half a dozen people worldwide have been diagnosed with #epidermodysplasia #verruciformis, or "tree man syndrome," but none until now have been women.

The warts appeared on Sahana Khatun's face four months ago and grew rapidly afterward.

Doctors say she displays a milder form of the disease, and hope she will make a quicker recovery 
than those in more advanced stages.

#treeman
link_name: Bangladesh treats first case of 'tree girl' syndrome

China's Five-hundred-meter Aperture Spherical Telescope, or #FAST, is joining forces with Breakthrough Initiatives to search for extraterrestrial #intelligent life.

The FAST is the world's largest single-dish radio #telescope, and can detect weaker signals than any other telescope.

It's about 20 times more sensitive than the 100-meter-diameter Green Bank Telescope in the U.S.

Breakthrough Initiatives was founded in 2015 with a $100 million donation from Russian billionaire Yuri Milner to accelerate the search for #alien life.
link_name: Chinese telescope joins hunt for aliens

"In our opinion, this work is very significant and marks a milestone in the stem cell research," first author Jun Wu of the U.S. Salk Institute for Biological Studies told Xinhua. "For the very first time, we demonstrate it's possible to generate human-pig chimeric embryos."

To create the chimeric embryos, Wu and colleagues first used a genome editing tool called CRISPR to delete critical genes for the development of an organ, such as the heart, pancreas or eye in early pig embryos, or blastocysts.

Thousands of people wearing thick coats and clutching suitcases lined up in freezing conditions on Wednesday at #Beijing #Railway Station in the hope of arriving home in time for China's #SpringFestival.

Travelers taking part in the world's largest annual human migration must be #home by Friday to usher in the new year at midnight. 

They are among hundreds of millions of #migrantworkers traveling to far-flung towns and cities to see their #families and celebrate the most important #holiday on the Chinese calendar.

The demand for tickets is so high that some people spend days trying to snare seats on public transport for the annual mega migration.

#Chinese annual #GDP growth hit 6.7 percent last year, pointing to stability in the world's number two #economy.

But the October-December increase of 6.8 percent marked the first quarterly improvement since the final three months of 2014.

The Asian giant is a crucial #driver of global growth and leaders are trying to reduce its reliance on exports and State-backed investment and instead focus on domestic consumer #spending to drive expansion.

The National Bureau of Statistics called the figure a "good start" for the government's goal of achieving 6.5 percent annual growth through 2020.

An enormous #fire engulfed a historic market in central #Jakarta, #Indonesia, on Thursday.

Hundreds of #firefighters were deployed to battle the blaze, which sent huge clouds of black #smoke floating over the city.

Several people suffered from minor burns.

The fire began at dawn on the ground floor of a #complex built during Dutch colonial rule.

Fifty fire engines were deployed to battle the blaze. The fire was still going strong in the afternoon.

It was not clear what caused the fire in the market.

The driver was killed instantly and four residents died after receiving #emergency treatment.

Further investigation into the incident is underway.

Loved for generations for corralling the catch into fishermen's nets, 
the 'smiling' Irrawaddy dolphins are being killed in record numbers by rogue gangs who use car batteries to stun aquatic life. The illegal technique now threatens to wipe out the dolphins and the tourist bonanza they promise. Irrawaddy dolphins can be found in rivers, lakes and seas across southern Asia, from the northwest Bay of Bengal, in India, to the south of Indonesia. For Irrawaddy locals, losing the dolphins is not just about destroying traditions from their past, it threatens their future. With fish stocks plummeting there are hopes ecotourism will prove a lifeline to bolster meagre incomes.
link_name: Myanmar's 'smiling' dolphins on brink of extinction

In the absence of an oak barrel, Chen Chao uses live bamboo trunks to age his spirit, a method reputed to confer a unique aroma and even medicinal benefits.The cereal liqueur is introduced into bamboo trunks "via high-pressure injection techniques. This method also reduces the alcohol content of the beverage, since the bamboo absorbs it. Chen learned the traditional technique in the eastern province of Fujian -- where it originated. He then launched his own brewing business in the famous Shunan Bamboo Sea, a vast forest known for the production of Wuliangye, a white spirit made with sorghum, sticky rice, maize, and wheat.
link_name: Chinese alcohol aged in bamboo for a new flavour

status_message:
#Electronic waste is rising sharply across #Asia, with serious consequences for human #health and the #environment, according to a recent UN study.

So-called e-waste in Asia has jumped 63 percent in five years, the report by the United Nations University said.

Asia has rapidly emerged as a major source of electronic waste, due to increasingly affluent consumers buying items such as phones, refrigerators and personal computers.

Per capita the worst-offending economy in the region was Hong Kong, with each person generating an average of 21.7 kilograms of e-waste in 2015.

Meanwhile, improper and illegal e-waste #dumping means increased exposure to extremely toxic chemicals, leading to severe health and environment consequences.

The study warned of a need for most nations across the region to improve #recycling and #disposal methods.
link_name: E-waste rising dangerously in Asia: UN study

Many #migrantworkers in #China's Pearl River Delta region have begun their journey home for the #SpringFestival, creating a "motorcycle army" in recent years.

The phenomenon started in early 2000s, with just a few migrant workers in #Guangzhou, who could not purchase rail tickets due to limited supply and high prices. Now the "army" has grown to 600,000 people annually traveling out of the region.

The road conditions can be harsh. Some gas stations have started to offer warm tea and snacks for free. It's often the only places for young mothers and children to rest on the road.

The travel often take days, but that does not discourage the workers from uniting with their #families.

The Spring Festival travel rush has kicked off in China. People around the country are making their way home to celebrate the Lunar New Year.
link_name: 'Motorcycle army' kicks off its way home

As well as ridding #Jakarta's 14 rivers of #rubbish, authorities have pushed a programme of evictions to clear housing alongside the waterways, allowing them to be widened.

This is aimed at easing the #floods that inundate Jakarta every year during the months-long rainy season.

The narrow ducts typically run through #slums, and residents have been dumping trash in the waterways for decades due to the lack of a decent rubbish disposal system in poor areas.

The rivers have been a central part of life for many in Jakarta for years, particularly those living in the poor slum areas that have grown up alongside them.

Max Baucus, the current #US #ambassador to #China, will leave Beijing for home on Jan 16. "We have made so many good friends here...I'm absolutely certain we will be back." President-elect Donald #Trump's transition team has issued a mandate requiring politically-appointed ambassadors like Baucus who were installed by President Barack Obama to leave their posts by Inauguration Day (Jan 20).Trump has nominated Iowa Governor Terry Branstad to become the next ambassador to China. The teachings of Confucius demand respect for tradition and elders to ensure harmony in a rigidly hierarchical society. This and was the official ideology of imperial China.

Recreational activities are also traditional: the boys learn Chinese chess while the girls perform tea ceremonies. 

While Confucian schools are still very much on the #fringe of China's education system their popularity is growing among middle class parents wanting a traditional education for their children.

#Sushi entrepreneur Kiyoshi Kimura paid top price at the first auction of the new year at #Tokyo's #Tsukiji fish #market on Thursday, bagging a 212kg #bluefin #tuna for 74.2 million yen.

At that price a single piece of fatty tuna sushi would cost roughly US$85, or 25 times the US$3.4 that Kimura charges for the product at his 51 stores across #Japan.

Every year, the boisterous #auction, which takes place in the small hours, makes national headlines.

But the 2017 auction may be the last at Tsukiji, the world's largest fish market.

It was originally supposed to move to a new location in November 2016, but the plan was put on hold, over concerns about toxic contamination at the new site.
link_name: Japan's 'Tuna King' wins annual auction for $636,000

status_message: A Vietnamese man has had scissors removed from his abdomen which were left behind during surgery 18 years ago. Ma Van Nhat, now 54, underwent surgery in 1998 after a car accident. He only recently discovered that doctors had left an unwelcome gift behind. The ultrasound that discovered the scissors only came about after Nhat reported stomach pains. Officials said they were searching for the doctors who performed the surgery in 1998, but have not yet tracked down any culprits.
link_name: Scissors pulled from Vietnam man 18 years after surgery

Two Russian ships made a rare stop in #Manila on Jan 3 goodwill visit.

The visit was the third ever by Russian #military vessels to the Philippines.

The Philippines is pivoting from its' decades-long US alliance toward China and Russia with Rodrigo Duterte at the helm.

#Duterte is expected to personally visit Russia in April or May.

A car lost control and fell into a #river, trapping 5 people onboard in #Nilka county, around 200km out of #Urumqi in northwest China.

Victims included a 70-year-old.

They were trapped in -12 degree Celsius river for hours.

Rescuers were hampered by the fast flowing river.

All 5 people were rescued after 3 hours.

Tourists attending a full #moon party in southern #Thailand on New Year's #Eve said they were left with burns when a #pyrotechnic display showered revellers with red-hot embers.

Footage showing how cheers turned to screams of panic as a giant sign reading "Happy New Year 2017" set alight was posted online.

Sparks could be seen raining down on the crowd, aided by an onshore breeze.

Eyewitnesses described mass panic as people scrambled to get out of the way of the display.

Police confirmed the incident but played down tourist reports of injuries and mass panic.
link_name: Tourists burned by Thai full moon party pyrotechnics

The 25-year-old was set to smash the Asian #transfer record with a reported 60 million euros deal with Shanghai #SIPG.

Dozens of supporters chanting club songs swarmed the former #Chelsea player at the city's #Pudong airport.

Oscar will join fellow Brazilian player #Hulk who joined SIPG for a reported 55 million euros in July 2016.

The pair will be coached by former Tottenham #Hotspur and Chelsea manager Andre Villas-Boas.

status_message:
With a record 1.1 tonnes of #cocaine worth hundreds of millions of dollars seized, a major cocaine ring has been dismantled in #Australia.

The street value of the cocaine, shipped from South America to the South Pacific, was estimated at $260 million.

14 Australians and one New Zealander aged between 29 and 63 were arrested, and charged with serious drug importation offences.

With high street prices attracting drug sellers to Australia, police said they made more than 18,000 imported #drug seizures in the last year.
link_name: Australia nets biggest cocaine bust on record

status_message:
A 7-year-old boy was spotted chasing a white SUV in #Zhuji, East China's #Zhejiang province.

A woman carelessly left her son on the roadside and drove away, after dropping of a relative at the train station.

The boy tried to open and hit the rear door of the SUV, but the car did not slow down, instead it increased speed. 

The woman recalled vehicles around her blaring their horns when she drove off. 

Thinking that she may have blocked others' way, she stepped on the gas to drive faster.

She found out her son missing after driving for about 2km and luckily, police found the boy and brought him to the police station for their reunification.

Twin baby pandas made their public debut at a safari park in #Guangzhou.

The male brothers were born in October to 14-year-old giant #panda Meiqing, who moved from #Sichuan province in 2012 to #Chimelong #Safari Park.

The monochromatic cubs weigh more than 4kg each and join seven other giant pandas which have called the Chimelong Safari Park home over the past four years.

status_message:
A giant South #Korean-built manned #robot that walks like a human has taken its first baby steps.

Designed by a veteran of #science fiction blockbusters, the four-meter, 1.5-ton Method-2 towers over its pilot.

It's the world's first manned #bipedal robot, according to robotics firm #HankookMiraea.

Method-2 will operate in hazardous areas where unprotected humans cannot tread.

The robot will be on sale by the end of 2017 at a price of around $8.3 million per unit.
link_name: S. Korean manned-mecha goes for a stroll

status_message:

Luckily, two witnesses saw the plunge and managed to fish him out with a long stick.

The surface of the Hunhe River is normally #frozen solid, but thinner surface #ice was the result of weekend warmer weather.

Temperatures at Shenyang have cooled, reaching lows of -20 degrees Celsius on Wednesday.
link_name: Man survives Northern China frozen fall

status_message:
A #Christmas-themed train set out on a journey to criss-cross #Pakistan in an effort to promote tolerance in the overwhelmingly #Muslim country.

Adorned with Christmas lights and mock snowmen, and with carriages that have portraits and tributes to notable #Christian Pakistanis, the government says it hopes to change mindsets in Pakistan, where attacks and persecution of religious minorities have become routine.

Christians make up an estimated 1.6 per cent of Pakistan's 200 million people and have long faced discrimination, sidelined into lowly paid jobs and often the target of trumped-up blasphemy charges.

#Discrimination and violence against religious minorities is commonplace in Pakistan, where Muslims account for more than 90 percent of the population.
link_name: Christmas train to spread tolerance in Pakistan

status_message:
According to a new study by the the All China Women's Federation and Beijing Normal University, 62 percent of parents in developed regions are unwilling to have a second #child, despite their relative financial security in China.

83 percent said they did not want a second child because they feared they would be unable to get them into a kindergarten or a decent school. 

The other main concerns were about the quality of baby products, the environment and access to healthcare.

According to the China National Committee on #Ageing, more than one-third of the population in 2050 will be senior citizens.

To reverse the ageing trend, the central government eased the restriction on a single child per family this year.

Dressed as #Santa Claus, riding #camels, trucks and bicycle, hundreds of #Pakistanis took part in the Santa Claus rally on Wednesday.

Some Pakistanis dressed as Santa Claus giving out gifts to car drivers passing by.

The rally was organized by the Rapha Mission International in collaboration with the United Minority Organisation, which aim to promote religious tolerance and #peace.
link_name: Pakistani revellers take part in Christmas rally

status_message:
Days of unseasonably torrential #rains have killed at least 24 people in central #Vietnam, inundating swathes of the region including #HoiAn, a town popular with tourists.

Coastal #BinhDinh province reported the heaviest death toll, with 16 killed and two reported missing since heavy rains began on December 12.

Hundreds of houses in remote areas are currently under water, and more than 32,000 hectares of crops have been destroyed.

Local forecasters warn of further rains later in the week.
link_name: Floods kill at least 24 in Vietnam

status_message:
China's next-generation #helicopter completed its first flight in Harbin on Tuesday.

The medium-sized #AC352 is a twin-engine helicopter developed by China's #Avicopter in partnership with France's #Airbus Helicopters.

The multi-purpose helicopter has a 7.5 tonne maximum take-off weight and is capable of carrying up to 16 people. It can be used in search and rescue, law enforcement and general transport.

The new helicopters are expected to be delivered to clients in 2018.
Photos show herdsmen's daily life after the #snow in this #winter scene on the Chenbaerhu grassland in Hulun Buir of the #InnerMongolia autonomous region. (Photos courtesy of Tang Xia )

Choi Soon-Sil, the woman at the centre of a corruption scandal that triggered the biggest political crisis for a generation in South #Korea, denied all charges as her fraud trial opened on Monday.

It was the first public appearance since October for Choi, who has been dubbed Korea's "female #Rasputin" for the influence she wielded over President Park.

As a long-time friend of Park, Choi is accused of leveraging her relationship with the president to strong-arm large companies like Samsung into handing over tens of millions of dollars.

An #impeachment motion against the president was passed by #parliament earlier this month.
link_name: Trial opens of 'Rasputin' at heart of S. Korea crisis

status_message:
Naomi Wu is a 23-year-old self-taught tinkerer, having learned her tech skills from online tutorials and groups.

The self described "sexycyborg" is keen to promote China as a center for innovation and women's roles in China's tech evolution.

Video footage showing a #bus #driver helping an #elderly passenger went viral online in #China.

Zhang, a bus driver in #Guangzhou, Guangdong Province, stopped the engine and jumped off the bus to help after he discovered an elderly passenger having a hard time to get off the bus.

Zhang lifted him off the bus and secured him on the pavement. 

The footage went viral online and received thumbs up from #netizens. 

And some passengers from the same bus called the traffic hotline to praise the driver.
link_name: Footage of bus driver helping old passenger goes viral online

Multiple groups of J-15 #fighter jet fired air-to-air and anti-ship missiles at targets during the exercise.

According to commander Xu Ying, chief of a J-15 squadron, pilots improved their use of tactics and weapons and enhanced confidence in their equipment through the exercise.

status_message:
As #Thailand enters peak tourist season, thousands of trevellers from around the world attend the famous #fullmoon #party on the island of #KoPhangan.

The party starts at dusk of every full moon night and carries on until dawn, with attractions including fire skipping ropes, alcohol buckets, #fireworks, and a very wide spectrum of #music.
 
The first full-moon party was held in 1985 for giving thanks to 20-30 travellers, but now it attracts 5,000 to 30,000 #tourists every full moon evening.
link_name: Thailand's iconic full-moon party hits top gear

status_message: The world is steering ahead in the Autonomous #vehicle revolution, which is set to transform the traditional automotive and #transport sectors, several countries started road trials, for details please check out the full coverage on www.asiaweekly.com.

Three caves in a remote Chinese village where #XiJinping stayed in his teenage years are receiving a constant stream of tourists, coming to pay homage four years after he came to power.

Xi spent seven years hauling grain and sleeping in cave homes on flea-bitten brick beds in #Liangjiahe when he was just 15.

Now the dusty village in #Shaanxi province, has been transformed into a living shrine to Xi's years of toil, with vintage posters, thermoses, and kerosene lamps giving the cave homes he occupied an authentic feel.

Between 1,000 and 7,000 #tourists visit every day, riding in on a highway opened this year, and Xi himself blessed the location with a return journey last year.
link_name: Chinese tourists pay homage in Xi Jinping village

status_message: On December 8, #Taichi master Chen Zhenglei and his students visited the United Nations headquarters in #NewYork, delivering a speech and some taijiquan performances for #UN staff members.

#Malaysia on Tuesday installed its 15th #king, #Sultan Muhammad V, a relatively youthful monarch known for his fondness for four-wheel driving and other extreme sports.

In a ceremony steeped in pomp and centuries of tradition, the 47-year-old Sultan, dressed in gold-coloured traditional Malay formal wear, took the oath of office in the national palace in #KualaLumpur.

Portraits of the king and queen adorn government buildings throughout the country. The king is also the symbolic head of Islam in the nation, as well as the nominal chief of the military.
link_name: Malaysia enthrones new king in lavish ceremony

status_message:
The northeast #China's #Jilin Province was silver-coated as a result of a sharp drop in temperature on Tuesday.

Temperatures in Jilin faced a sharp drop of 22 degree celsius to -20 degree celsius on Tuesday and trees were covered by #frost.

Large crowds of tourists and photography enthusiasts were attracted to the scene to capture this spectacular moment.

The frost in Jilin is regarded as one of China's four natural wonders.
link_name: Frost creates silver-coated world in China

According to #China's officials on Monday, the South-to-North #Water #Transfer Project has significantly relieved the water crisis in the Northern part of the country.

110 million people from 35 cities have benefited since the project started. More than 5.8 billion cubic meters of water has been supplied to Northern China.

The South-to-North Water Transfer Project is the world's largest water project, which aims to transfer fresh water from the humid South of China to the arid North.
link_name: 110 million benefit from South-to-North Water Transfer Project

Finding new partners, integrating big data into businesses and fostering cross-border e-commerce are just some of the things Jiang Ming and 25 other representatives from the Chinese retail industry have been talking about as they started a weeklong tour in the US and Canada.

The building of the main stadium for the #Tokyo 2020 #Olympics officially started Sunday, more than a year after the original blueprints were torn up following public outcry over the skyrocketing costs.

Japan approved the new stadium plans in September after #Abe scrapped the initial design as costs soared beyond $2 billion.

The Olympic #stadium is due to be completed by the end of November 2019, five months behind schedule.

The new venue is being built on the site of the former national stadium which was used for the 1964 Tokyo Olympics.
link_name: Tokyo starts construction of main Olympic stadium

In Changning, south China's #Guangdong Province, thousands of #pigs became homeless after their illegally built home was demolished.

Local environment protection authorities carried out the demolition process after they had given the illegal farm a warning. 

The pigs then strayed around the torn-down farm and foraged amongst the ruins.
link_name: Thousands of pigs turned homeless in China

status_message:
Nearly 70 percent of the #Sumatran #elephants habitat has been destroyed in a single generation, says conservation group WWF, driving them into ever-closer contact with humans.

Keeping the peace between elephants and humans is a round-the-clock job for rangers.

Confrontations between elephants and humans can quickly turn violent in Sumatra, where competition for space has intensified as the island's forests have been rapidly cleared for timber and farming.

At the Margahayu station half a dozen rangers patrol the borders with a squad of six captive elephants under their command.

The response units recruit locals to thaw suspicion and foster a sense of joint responsibility for the future of the iconic species.

The frequency of clashes has dropped up to 80 percent since they began patrolling the area in 2015.
link_name: Captive elephants help save wild cousins on forest frontline

status_message:
#Aftershocks rattled the survivors of a devastating #Indonesian #earthquake that killed more than 100 people, as officials urgently appealed for medicine and doctors to treat the hundreds injured.

The shallow 6.5-magnitude quake levelled hundreds of homes, mosques and businesses across #Aceh province.

More than 700 people were injured in the quake, many seriously.

Medical supplies and other essentials are lacking, officials said, with the region's ill-equipped hospitals overwhelmed.

Aid has begun trickling into the region, with emergency #shelters erected to house those left with nowhere to go, but more was needed for the 4,000 people evacuated to shelters.
link_name: Urgent appeal for supplies in Indonesia

status_message: People live longer in #HongKong than anywhere else, but the city also has an alarmingly high percentage of elders in care homes. What can be done to keep this growing population at home?
link_name: Home sweet home for the aged

status_message:
China's top court issued a verdict on Thursday in a lengthy trademark dispute involving US #basketball legend Michael #Jordan's right to protect his name.

The Supreme People's Court ruled that the registered trademark of Chinese company #Qiaodan Sports－"Qiaodan" is a transliteration of "Jordan" in Chinese characters, infringes on Jordan's right to his name and violates provisions of the Trademark Law.

By law, Jordan can now file lawsuits against Qiaodan Sports seeking compensation.

Michael Jordan responded in a statement, "I'm happy that the top court has recognized the right to protect my name."
link_name: China's highest court hands Jordan partial victory

status_message:
A Pakistani #plane carrying 48 people crashed in the country's mountainous north and burst into flames killing everyone on board on Wednesday.

#Pakistan International #Airlines #Flight #PK661 came down after one of its two turboprop engines failed while travelling from the city of Chitral to Islamabad.

Rescuers, including hundreds of villagers, pulled the charred remains from the wreckage of the aircraft, parts of which were found hundreds of metres away from the main site in Abbottabad district of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province.

Two Austrians and one Chinese were among the victims.

It's one of the deadliest aviation accidents in the nation's history.

Asia's retail banking sector faces an uncertain future as risks mount and fintechs pose a serious threat to the established order, asiaweekly went to Shenzhen to find out what's happening, for more detail, please check out www.asiaweekly.com tomorrow.

In southwest China's #Chongqing, a luxury #Bentley worth over US$430,000 #crashed into a wall.

Video from a dash cam captured a woman getting out of her car to pay for #parking, and the car rolling down the slope towards the exit.

The woman failed to stop it and finally the car smashed into a wall of the car park.

"The woman didn't shift the car to a parking gear and didn't apply the hand brake," according to local traffic police.

The driver has been asked to pay the bill for repairing the wall.
link_name: $3 million RMB Bentley crashes into a wall

status_message:
Conservative, family-value groups are in an uproar over two #rainbow colored statues displayed in Hong Kong's CBD. 

The flanking bronze lions guarding #HSBC's public entrance were temporarily replaced by two multi-colored replicas as a show of support for the #LGBT community.

The prominent display triggered petitions against the artwork, with critics deriding the pastel pieces as disgusting.

The statues, decorated by local artist Michael Lam, are scheduled to be on display through the end of the year.
link_name: Bank's rainbow paint job irks anti-LGBT groups

status_message: An increasing number of black-headed #gulls have headed to the #DianchiLake in #Kunming, Yunnan province, for winter in recent years, attracting great interest among visitors.

A pre-dawn #inferno at #Karachi's #Regent Plaza #Hotel killed 12 people and wounded 75 on Monday.
Desperate guests jumped from windows and scrambled down knotted bedsheets to escape.

The blaze broke out while many guests were still asleep.  A lack of fire alarms and emergency exits left many trapped in their rooms.

Many of the victims succumbed to smoke inhalation or suffocated. Others suffered cuts or fractures as they climbed down makeshift ropes or leapt from the eight-storey hotel's upper floors to safety.

The cause of the fire is still under investigation.
link_name: 12 dead, 75 injured in Pakistan hotel fire

#Afghan #female #volleyballers made a rare call for #equality at a Kabul tournament, using national attention at the event to throw a spotlight on gender policies in the deeply conservative, war-torn #Muslim country.

The United Nations hosted the tournament as part of a campaign against #gender violence in #Afghanistan.

Afghanistan remains one of the worst places in the world to be a #woman, according to international observers. 

Gender equality in Afghanistan has improved since the ousting of the hardline Taliban regime in 2001, but #women still suffer tight restrictions and violence.
link_name: Afghan female volleyball players rally for change

China has imposed an extra 10 percent tax on ultra high-end cars costing over 1.3RMB (US$188k) including Lamborghinis and Ferraris.

The new tax will "guide rational consumption" and promote energy-efficient vehicles, according to the finance ministry.

China already has a 25% tax on imported foreign vehicles. 

Taxes have yet to dim interest in ultra high-end brands such as #Ferrari, with Q2 sales surging 26 percent this year, with 160 units delivered.

Around 30,000 #protesters took part in a rally Wednesday to demand the resignation of South #Korea's #President #Park Geun-Hye, after lawmakers announced that an impeachment vote will be postponed by at least a week. 

Park said Tuesday she would let parliament decide her fate following accusations that she colluded with secretive confidante Choi Soon-Sil to coerce firms to donate tens of millions of dollars to foundations which were used for Choi's personal gain. Choi has been dubbed "Korea's #Rasputin" by the media.

Park has been named as a suspect in the investigation — a first for a sitting president in South Korea.
link_name: Thousands march to demand president's resignation in South Korea

status_message:
Chinese manufacturer #CRRC will build new #trains for #Sydney's rail system, under a sub-contract arrangement with #Australia's Downer EDI.

Downer EDI was awarded the $1.7 billion contract for 24 double-decker trains, with an option for another 45, with a maintenance period of 25 years.

The first batch of trains is expected to begin operating in 2019, and the manufacturing of all trains completed in 2026.

It's the largest railway project in Australia's history.
link_name: Sydney's new trains to be built by China

status_message: A group of Washington state high school students who returned from the trip of a lifetime to #China in October receives a letter signed by Chinese President Xi Jinping and first lady Peng Liyuan. The letter said, "Young people are the future and hope of a country. We hope the students will share their experience and impressions of China with people around them, so that more Americans will get to know China better.

Renowned Chinese-American conductor Xian Zhang was appointed as #NJSO's Music Director late last year. How would she interpret the challenges throughout her career as a female #conductor, and the differences between conducting education in China and in the US?

Scientists confirm that a mass bleaching incident on the #Great #Barrier #Reef earlier this year has killed more #corals, across large swathes of the biodiverse site than ever before.

The 2,300km long reef, the world's largest coral #ecosystem, suffered the most severe bleaching in recorded history due to warming sea temperatures in March and April.

A 700km stretch of reefs in the less-accessible, and more pristine, north lost 67 percent of their shallow-water corals in the past eight to nine months. 

Scientists estimate it will take at least 10 to 15 years to regain the lost corals.
link_name: Record coral kill off on Great Barrier Reef

status_message:
A major #renovation project has started to protect the walls of the #Forbidden City from ageing.

It is The World #Heritage Site's biggest restoration project since 1949.

The first phase has begun on a 233-meter section of the western wall of the Xihaumen complex.

The Forbidden City was built as a palace in 1420, with walls of around 9.3 meters high and 8.5 meters thick.

There were several major restorations in the 17th and 18th centuries, following heavy storms and earthquakes.

The entire restoration project is expected to be completed in 2020.

#Sydney's #Taronga #Zoo is celebrating its first successful #echidna births in 30 years with three healthy babies, known as #puggles, from three different mums hatching within days of each other.

The puggles all hatched within a short period in August and have now opened their eyes and begun to develop their characteristic spines.

Echidnas, or spiny anteaters, are notoriously difficult to breed in human care and are elusive in the wild. They are one of only two #Australian #mammals that lay eggs, along with the #platypus.
link_name: First successful echidna born in 30 years in Sydney

Experts have confirmed that a group of #sinkholes discovered #Hanzhong, #Shaanxi province in Northwest China, contains the largest number of the rare #geological phenomenon in the world.

The area comprises one super large sinkhole, as well as 17 large and 31 conventional sinkholes.

The largest one was in #Zhenba, which had the widest diameter of 520 meters and a depth of up to 320 meters.

Sinkholes are formed when carbonate rocks are eroded for a long time by an underground river which hollows out the rocks which eventually collapse.

It is a rare geological phenomenon that can take up to 500,000 years to form.
link_name: World's biggest cluster of sinkholes wows geologists

status_message:
At least 74 people were killed when part of a #power station under construction in #Fengcheng, #Jiangxi Province of China #collapsed Thursday.

A cooling tower platform plunged to the ground in the early hours, trapping an unknown number of people beneath it.

The construction of two 1,000-megawatt coal-fired power units at the #Ganneng Fengcheng power station began last July and was expected to be completed by early 2018.

Rescue work is underway, and a total of 32 firetrucks and 212 military personnel had been deployed to the scene.

Hundreds of #Rohingya have arrived in #Bangladesh after fleeing violence in neighbouring #Myanmar.

Bangladeshi troops have intensified patrols along the 237km border.

The police detained dozens of Rohingya #migrants, some of them children, and said they would return them to Myanmar where there are reports the #military is burning villages and raping women.

Myanmar troops have poured into a strip of land that is home to the stateless #Muslim Rohingya minority since a series of attacks on police border posts last month.
link_name: Hundreds of Rohingya cross into Bangladesh, fleeing unrest

115 new #trains made in #China are now arriving in #Thailand, bringing a new era of #railways in Thailand.

The existing rail network in Thailand is old fashioned, and noisy. The government invested US$140 million to change the trains.

The new trains are air-conditioned, with cushioned seats for a comfortable journey. First-class sleepers can even enjoy a shower, personal TV and wifi.

Thai's rail authorities hope they can attract up to a million new passengers a year.

The 19kg tree is made up of more than 1,200 meters of gold wire, as fine as angel hair pasta.

A passenger #train #derailed in northern India Sunday. Fourteen carriages leapt from the tracks, killing at least 120 #travellers most of whom were sleeping when the fatal #accident occurred.

Hundreds of army personnel and police have been deployed at the scene. Disaster response teams also set up special lights to ensure rescue work was not hampered in the night.

It's the worst #disaster to hit the country's ageing rail network in recent years.

#India's railway network, one of the world's largest, is still the main form of long-distance travel in the country, but it is poorly funded and deadly accidents occur relatively frequently.

To clear the roads for the 606,000 students to ensure they arrive in time for their #college entrance #exam, government offices, major businesses and even #Seoul's stock market opened an hour later than usual at 10:00 am on Thursday.

Transport authorities banned all airport landings and take-offs for a 30-minute time-span in the early afternoon to coincide with the main language listening tests.

Teenagers in S. Korea spend years preparing for  their entrance exams which, when successful, means a place in one of the #elite colleges which is the key to a future #career and even marriage prospects.

The pressure to score well in the exams has been blamed for the country's teenage depression and #suicide rates that are among the highest in the world.

The movie plot of the Hong Kong film "#Shaolin #Soccer" is becoming reality.

A Henan-based soccer school funded by the Shaolin Temple, kung fu's spiritual home, wants to bring the discipline of #martial arts to the game.

The "Shaolin soccer training base" has ambitions to use traditional martial arts techniques to produce elite football players.

Some 1,500 students, both male and female, have signed up for the new soccer programme,

Every day the students practice for several hours.

The school has signed a deal with a British firm to bring coaches from abroad. 

China is investing hugely in football training and has vowed to have 50 million school-age players by 2020, as the country aims for a football superpower status by 2050.

Controversial #Indian mining tycoon, Gali Janardhan Reddy, took over #Bangalore #Palace and flew in Brazilian dancers as part of his daughter's #wedding, reportedly costing US$75 million.

Local media criticized the extravagance at a time when many Indians are struggling to find the cash to buy food following the government's move to pull high-value notes out of circulation.

Indians rely heavily on cash for daily transactions and those living in rural areas or without bank accounts have been particularly hard hit.

One associate defended the lavish expenditure, saying Reddy just wanted people to remember the wedding of his only daughter.
link_name: Big, fat Indian wedding amid cash crunch

A baby #monkey has joined a herd of #goats in east China's #Jiangxi Province.

The small creature was found by goat farmer Zhong She.

The simian was scared when it saw the farmer and quickly bolted on the back of a goat.

The monkey clings to the back of the goats when they go out to forage and sleeps with them at night.

County #wildlife authorities are taking measures to protect the monkey and plan to transfer it to the nearby Yichun Zoo.

#Pangolins are the most trafficked mammal on earth. 

About one million pangolins have been plucked from Asian and African forests over the past decade. 

They're now on the list of species at the highest risk of #extinction.

In many parts of Asia, their meat is considered a delicacy, and their scales prized as traditional medicine, especially in China, regardless of an absence of scientific evidence for its medical benefits.

Vietnamese conservationists are fighting to save the creatures from extinction.

They will bring up the agenda at a major #wildlife conference opening in #Hanoi on Thursday.
link_name: Pangolins at serious risk of extinction

"The first time I saw this boy, I thought my family had uploaded my childhood picture," Ma said in a Weibo post.

Ma said he will sponsor the education of the boy until he graduates from college.

As people around the world tried to get a glimpse of the '#supermoon', the skies over northern #Thailand were lit up with thousands of paper #lanterns for the spectacular Yi Peng #festival.

Yi Peng is a festival in northern Thailand to show respect for the #Buddha. It is held at the full moon of the second month of the northern Thai lunar calendar.

Scores of sky lanterns made of thin paper and bamboo are released into the sky. It's believed that if they disappear from view before their fires goes out, they bring an end to misfortune.

During the festival, people also decorate their houses, gardens, and temples with intricate lanterns.
link_name: Lantern festival marks full moon Thai-style

Northeast China has suffered heavy smog recently, but a cold front swept away the pollution on Tuesday, giving Beijingers a spectacular view of the "#supermoon".

#Skygazers in #Beijing took to high-rise buildings and observatories to get a glimpse of the closest "supermoon" to Earth in almost seven decades.

The unusually big and bright moon appeared at its most impressive just as night fell over Asia.

The phenomenon happens when the moon is full at the same time as it reaches its closest point to Earth
on its monthly orbit.

Because of the full moon's rare proximity, NASA dubbed the celestial event an "extra-supermoon".

Anyone who missed this celestial event will have to wait for 2034 to see its like again.

#Japan is ready to act if necessary to cope with turmoil in financial markets, as stocks fell and the yen surged on Donald #Trump's shock victory in the US presidential election.

A strong yen hurts the bottomline of Japan's exporters, making their products more expensive in overseas markets and denting the value of profits earned abroad.

In Tokyo trading, the dollar slumped to 102.10 yen from above 105 yen seen earlier in the day.

Masatsugu Asakawa, vice-minister of finance for international affairs, signalled possible currency intervention to weaken the yen.
link_name: Japanese stock falls on Trump victory

status_message: Despite its rapid expansion, the yuan still has some distance to go before its share of global payments matches the size of the Chinese economy. To test this we went out on the streets of Hong Kong to see for ourselves. For more information, please see tomorrow's Asiaweekly.

A boy was trapped in a well in #Baoding City, Hebei Province of China, for more than 90 hours.

The six-year-old boy accidentally fell into the abandoned well after following his father onto their farmland on Sunday.

The well, which is 45 meters deep and only 35cm diameter, was abandoned for about 5 years. It was covered by a thin board and soil, which had become hidden.

Over 100 rescuers and 60 excavators joined the rescue, but the boy was still missing when the excavation reached 2 meters from the bottom of the well.

The rescue is still on going.
link_name: Boy trapped in well for 90 hours

#Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi orders the withdrawal of 500 and 1,000 rupee notes from circulation in a shock announcement designed to tackle widespread corruption and tax evasion.

People could exchange their old notes for new bills at banks or post offices until the end of the year, or deposit them in their accounts. They would no longer be legal tender from Tuesday midnight.

After a one-day shutdown of all banks and ATMs, the new 500 and 2,000 rupee denomination notes will be issued from Thursday by the Reserve Bank of India, the country's central bank.

Gas stations run by public sector oil companies, hospitals and transport operators will continue to accept the old notes for the next 72 hours.
link_name: India pulls 500 & 1,000 rupee notes to fight graft

A total of 50,085 Chinese dancers in 14 cities, including #Shanghai, Xi'an, #Dalian and #Tianjin, danced at the same time, setting a new #Guinness World Record for multiple-site large-scale dancing.

The number beat the previous record of 18,431 which was set in #Hebei Province last year.

Square dancing is very popular in #China, every morning and evening, dancing seniors gather in public squares to perform the dances. 

It's also treated as a way to communicate with neighbours.
link_name: 50,000 Chinese dancers set a new world record

#Delhi state was compared to a "gas chamber" by its chief minister.

People have been protesting calling for action over the city's high levels of #pollution which have lead to the closure of 1,800 schools as thick #smog blanketed the city for several days.

New Delhi's air quality has steadily worsened over the years, a result of rapid urbanisation.

It also suffers from atmospheric #dust, the burning of crop stubble in farms around the city and pollution from open fires lit by the urban poor to keep warm in winter or to cook food.
link_name: Delhi state smog draws 'gas chamber' comparison

Every year in September of the #Tibetan Lunar Calendar, which usually falls between October to November in the Gregorian calendar, #Potala #Palace will start its annual #repainting works.

The #paint used in the repainting is mixed with white sugar, brown sugar, rock candy, milk and honey, in order to make the paint more sticky to the wall.

In recent years, the repainting time was reduced to less than 20 days from more than a month, thanks to the use of electric tools.
link_name: Tibet's Potala Palace starts annual repainting

One of #Vietnam's top tourist draws is a town called #Sapa, nestled in a #UNESCO-protected area of cascading rice terraces.

Getting to the top of #Fansipan Mountain is a two-day trek but most visitors opt for a 20-minute ride by the new cable car.

Locals complain rapid development is scarring the area with luxury hotels while the new cable car has marred pristine views from the region's peaks.

Porters are losing jobs and turning to construction, as fewer people climb the mountain.

Some also worry investments have been short-sighted, aimed at maximising visitor numbers at the expense of sustainability.

Saltwater #crocodiles have been a protected species in #Australia since their near-extinction 45 years ago. But now their numbers have exploded to approximately 100,000.

A spate of recent attacks has reignited debate about controlling them.

The giant #predators, which can grow up to seven meters long and weigh more than a tonne, haunt waterways in the country's north.

Some tourism businesses have come under fire for dangling meat to entice them to jump up in front of sightseers on boat trips.

"No saltwater croc is friendly," warned indigenous tour guide Reuben Jones. "They're basically all going to kill you."

#China's only #icebreaker, the #Xuelong or Snow Dragon, is making a scientific expedition to the world's least-explored continent.

The 256-member team includes experts in glaciers, biology, meteorology and other fields. The expedition departed from Shanghai and will last 160 days.

The team will choose a site for a new research station in the Ross Sea area and will also study changes to the world's environment over the past 50,000 years.

Chinese Premier #LiKeqiang's visit to #Latvia is a historical occasion, the first by a Chinese Premier since Latvia gained independence in 1991. In #Riga, Latvia, Li will attend the annual forum of heads of state from 16 Central and Eastern European (#CEE) countries. The European Union will also be in attendance as an observer, indicating how critical the "16+1" cooperative mechanism has become for China's relations with Europe.

Around 7,000 #NewZealand school children stomped and bellowed their way through what is believed to be the largest-ever #haka on Wednesday, claiming a new world record for the #Maori war dance.

The children performed the haka challenge at a park in #Masterton, watched closely by local stewards monitoring the event for the #Guinness World Records.

The current record was set in 2014, when 4,028 people performed the haka in France.

The haka originated as a battlefield challenge but is now performed at weddings and funerals, as well as sporting events.
link_name: New Zealand school kids claim world's biggest haka

status_message: #AsiaWeekly: The fever of learning #Chinese globally, www.asiaweekly.com

A #firefighter from #Gansu Province of northwest China, showed his unique skill on a TV show.

Using a toothless band saw, Li Haifeng cut through a steel wire millimetres above a light bulb, while the bulb stayed intact.

The wires and bulbs are located inside a black box, which he can't see, all he can do is feel them with the saw.

He finished cutting three wires located at different heights without breaking any of the bulbs.

Li uses the same tool for rescuing children who get rings stuck on their fingers, which also needs high accuracy and precision.
link_name: Chinese firefighter shows his unique skill

#Tokyo nursed a giant #pumpkin-sized hangover Monday after a weekend of #Halloween revelry.

For the normally reserved Japanese, the macabre celebration of the dead is an excuse to slip on a wacky #costume and let their hair down at boozy parties.

With Halloween falling on a Monday this year, major weekend parades in Tokyo and #Kawasaki, south of the capital, drew some 250,000 party-goers while Tokyo Disneyland also enjoyed a bumper two days.

Halloween is a billion-dollar industry in #Japan with an estimated 20 million people nationwide getting into the grisly #spirit.
link_name: Japanese go all in to celebrate Halloween

China's international #aerospace #exhibition, opened in #Zhuhai today. 

This year boasts its largest-ever display of #military hardware and #aircraft, with 11 exhibition halls, 430,000 square metres of indoor and outdoor viewing area, and 151 aircraft from 700 exhibitors from 42 countries and regions.

China's newest warplane, the J-20 #stealth #fighter, will make its first public flight at the show.

The newest Y-20 transport aircraft and H-6k bomber will also appear in the show.

The show runs from November 1st to 6th in Zhuhai, Guangdong Province.

Chinese #sailing star #Guo Chuan went missing in the Pacific Ocean during an attempt to set a new solo world record last Tuesday.

Guo is believed to have fallen overboard from his #trimaran on Tuesday about 900km from #Hawaii.Only Guo's lifejacket was found aboard the vessel.

A nearby Chinese cargo ship has been assisting in the search, and the over 1,000 vessels of the China Ocean Shipping Company (#COSCO) have been ordered to keep a lookout for the lost sailor.

Guo, 51, was aiming to set a new solo non-stop trans-Pacific world record from San Francisco to Shanghai, setting sail on October 19.
link_name: China sailing star missing for six days

An #Indonesian woman was jailed for 20 years for murdering a friend from an Australian college with poisoned coffee in a "sadistic" fashion, capping a sensational trial that has gripped the country.

Jessica Kumala #Wongso, 28, was found guilty of murdering Wayan Mirna #Salihin by slipping #cyanide into her drink at an upmarket Jakarta cafe.

The murder was carried out in January by Wongso after becoming angered at 27-year-old Salihin's criticism of her boyfriend.

Wongso had denied murdering her friend, breaking down in tears as she took the stand during the trial to reject the allegations. Her legal team said they would file an appeal.
link_name: Indonesian handed 20 years in 'poisoned coffee' murder

#Shared #refrigerators were setup by #Shanghai's authorities and restaurants in #Putuo District, to provide free food for the disabled and elderly.

One of the fridges was set up in a community reading room, where the foods were supplied by two supermarkets, a restaurant and a food bank.

An estimated 35 percent of food is wasted annually in China, which is worth more than $200 billion RMB.
link_name: Free food in Shanghai's shared refrigerators

status_message:
Chinese sailor lost at sea

Chinese sailor #GuoChuan has gone missing while attempting to set a new sailing world record for a solo ocean crossing. Rescuers boarded his drifting 97-foot trimaran, Qingdao China, and found his life jacket about 620 miles northwest of Oahu, Hawaii, in the Pacific Ocean. Guo, 50, had set sail from San Francisco on Oct 17 with a destination of Shanghai. The US Coast Guard has suspended its search and expressed its deep condolences. In 2013, Guo became the first Chinese sailor to complete a nonstop solo circumnavigation of the globe.

A new report from the World Bank showed that nearly 800 million people lived on less than US$1.9 a day in 2013. 

That is around 100 million fewer extremely #poor people than in 2012.

According to the report, from 1990 to 2013, the extremely poor fell from 35% to 11% of the world's  population.

�"Much of the success in poverty reduction globally has actually been driven by China's incredible success in reducing poverty," 
Ana Revenga, senior director on poverty and quality at the World Bank

The progress on extreme #poverty was driven mainly by East Asia and Pacific, especially #China, #Indonesia and #India.

The report forecasted that the world would be unable to achieve the goal of ending extreme poverty by 2030.

The World Bank called on countries to adopt policies, such as early childhood education, universal health coverage, and cash transfers to poor families, to create growth and enable the poorest to take advantage of opportunities.
link_name: China's success drives global poverty reduction globally

A 26-year-old woman in China records 25 years of birthday wishes to her new born baby.

Lin was suffering with #osteosarcoma, a type of bone #cancer, while she discovered she was #pregnant earlier this year.

Although the child was born healthy, doctors judged that her life was coming to the end. She then recorded a video that wished her baby happy birthday for every year until she reached 25 years old.
link_name: Cancer mom records 25 years of birthday wishes to her baby

#Polluted #air is a "public health emergency", the World #Health Organization said Tuesday. Nine out of ten people globally breathe bad air that causes more than six million deaths a year.

#WHO warned that nearly 90-percent of air pollution-related deaths occur in low and middle-income countries. 

Southeast #Asia and the Western #Pacific region, including #China, are the hardest hit.

South Asia is also badly affected, with the WHO saying poor air quality is responsible for the deaths of more than 600,000 people in #India every year.
link_name: Asia's poor choking on filthy air

#Typhoon #Megi caused a #landslide in a small village in #SuiChang, east #China's #Zhejiangg Province on Wednesday.

At least 26 people were missing and 15 have been rescued, a further six were missing after another landslide in Baofeng village.

Typhoon Megi has already killed four people and injured more than 500 in Taiwan before it hit the Chinese mainland.

#China completed the world's largest radio telescope, the Five-hundred-meter Aperture Spherical Telescope (#FAST) on Sunday.

The FAST, located in #Guizhou Province, took more than five years and $185 million to build.

According to #Xinhua, 8,000 people were relocated to make room for FAST.

status_message:
#GlamorChina Located on the southwest of the foot of #HuangshanMountain in Yi County, #Anhui Province, Hong Village is a tranquil bull-shaped antique whose name symbolizes expansion and prosperity.

 It has a long history of more than 900 years featuring green hills, limpid river, white walls and dark tiles. Since the village is located on the hills where the cloud is sometimes splashing while sometimes transparent, the village looks like a Chinese ink and wash painting characterized by rich culture and beautiful scenery. 

As one of the World Historic and Cultural Heritage, the village has always been appealing to visitors all over the world, including many film directors such as An Li who shot his Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon there.
link_name: Hong Village in Yi County, Anhui Province

Two days earlier, the dog went on a rampage on #Guanghua Road in the central business district of Beijing, and attached dozens of people.

Victims ranging from 4 years old to over 60, received vaccinations against rabies after the bite.

The death toll from a series of #landslides and flash #floods in #Indonesia climbed to 19 on Wednesday, including several children found dead by rescuers.

In #Garut, torrential downpours saw floodwaters quickly rise to 2 metres, at least 16 people were killed and eight others are still missing in the area.

Three more people died in a landslide in #Sumedang.

More than one thousand people have been forced from their homes in the district and are taking shelter in nearby emergency tents set up by search and rescue teams.

status_message:
There are over 30,000 bats in Hong Kong some living in old disused buildings and under roofing tiles. 
But they are losing their habitats due to human encroachment, driven out by urbanization. A tiny insect-eating bat can eat more than 3,000 mosquito-sized insects a night. With Zika and other mosquito born diseases on the rise is it time to rethink the importance of bats in our communities?

Global warming could destroy one-third of its remaining #bamboo habitat within 80 years, the #IUCN warned, while its native biomes have already reduced over the past 100 years in the wake of China's economic development.

The pair came into contact with an electrical pole as a herd of 30-35 wild elephants passed through an elephant corridor over the weekend.

Locals said the second elephant was electrocuted while trying to rescue the first one.

Police tried several methods to free, including rolling along the mud. In a last ditch attempt they brought in an excavator, which successfully pulled him to safety.

status_message:
A #Japanese man aged 73 became the world's oldest person to swim across Japan's #Tsugaru Strait, braving currents and stinging jellyfish in his quest.

Toshio Tominaga's record took 10 hours swimming across the 20km wide channel, considered one of the world's most difficult due to strong and unpredictable currents

Past #swimmers have encountered #sharks and fended off #jellyfish and #squid to complete the crossing.
Leaders of the world's 20 largest economies ended their two-day meeting in Hangzhou China with an agreement to revive growth in the global economy. #AsiaWeekly #G20

#French auto giant PSA #Peugeot #Citroen opened its fifth China factory as buyers seek sport-utility vehicles.

Peugeot and China partner #Dongfeng Motors unveiled the #Chengdu factory which will produce 300,000 vehicles a year.

The French company aims to increase sales in China and Southeast Asia to one million by 2018.
link_name: France opens fifth China Peugeot plant

status_message:
A second batch of electric buses will hit Hong Kong's streets on September 12. The aim is to provide a two-year trial to assess the buses' performance under local conditions.
 
Five single-decker buses will ply different routes on Hong Kong Island. The buses, called Great Dragon, were purchased by New World First Bus and Citybus Limited, with the help of Government's subsidies. 

The Hong Kong Government aims to make all public transport buses zero emission.
link_name: Hong Kong introduces more electric buses

status_message: Two wild #pandas have been caught on infrared camera at Qianfoshan National Nature Reserve in Sichuan province. Workers discovered the video of the pandas, which was shot on August 3, when they retrieved the camera on Tuesday.

The giant #panda status was changed Sunday from "endangered" to "vulnerable", according to the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN).

The latest estimates show a population of 1,864 adult giant pandas, adding cubs to the projection would mean about 2,060 pandas exist in the wild today.

The improved status confirms that the Chinese government's efforts to conserve this species have been effective, but the IUCN also warn that the warming planet could wipe out more that one third of the panda's bamboo habitat in the next 80 years.
link_name: Giant Panda off the endangered list

status_message: #Video Shui Xiu, a captive #panda in the Wolong National Nature Reserve in Sichuan province, gave birth to a cub without human assistance on Monday evening. It was the first time she had become a mother in the reserve's base for sending captive pandas to the wild.
link_name: Panda Shui Xiu Gave Birth To a Cub

status_message:
The #Kabul #zoo, the only one in the country, is located in the heart of the #Afghan capital, surrounded by a dense warren of muddy flat-topped houses.

Most of the animals were killed or escaped during the 1992-1995 civil war.

The zoo has since undergone a slow and painful reconstruction, now housing around 600 animals, many of them gifted by countries such as India and China.

It has become a popular place for people in need of recreation, offering a safe and peaceful refuge, especially for women and children.
link_name: Kabul's once battle-scarred zoo roars back to life

status_message:

In opening it DJI hopes to expand its flying courses for unmanned aerial vehicles (UAV) to other parts of the world.

S.#Korea has been catching up in using #UAV in different fields, as the government recently opened a drone park for the public and loosened related regulations.

- video from CCTV

At least 35 people were killed Sunday when a bus collided with a fuel tanker and burst into flames in #Zabul Province, southern #Afghanistan.

Many of the victims, including women and children, were burned beyond recognition.

Afghanistan has some of the world's most dangerous roads, often in dilapidated condition, and traffic rules are seldom enforced.

Many in the country rely on old and rickety passenger vehicles and road accidents with high casualty rates are common.

The world's oldest male #panda celebrated his 31st birthday in #Chengdu, #Sichuan Province.

Pan Pan, whose age is equivalent to about 100 human years, lives on despite suffering from cancer, serious tooth wear and organ problems.

The world's oldest panda, Jia Jia in Hong Kong Ocean Park, is a female who just turned 38 last month.
link_name: World's oldest male panda celebrates 31st birthday

status_message:
Authorities in #Singapore report they have detected 151 people infected with the #Zika #virus, as the #mosquito-fighting effort continued in a bid to curb the spread of the disease.

The first locally-transmitted cases were confirmed last Saturday.

Zika, causes only mild symptoms for most people such as fever and a rash.

But pregnant women who catch it can give birth to babies with #microcephaly, a deformation marked by abnormally small brains and heads.

The University of #Melbourne in #Australia reconstructed the face of an #Egyptian #mummy using computed tomography scans and 3D printing technology.

The printing of the skull took 140 hours. Afterward, a sculptor created the face using forensic facial reconstruction.

Researchers believe the skull belonged to a female not more than 25 years old at the time of death, at least 2000 years ago.

- video from University of Melbourne

Messner's institute and the Kiel Institute for the World Economy, both globally influential #thinktanks, are expected to play an important role in Germany's G20 presidency next year. The two institutes are tasked with chairing and organizing the T20 (think tank 20) process, which serves as an idea bank for the G20. #G20Hangzhou #G20Summit

Events include traditional versions of #wrestling, #hunting and #horse racing, and the eye-catching Kok-Boru, a game in which horse riders fight for control of the carcass of a freshly-slaughtered goat.

The games are aimed at boosting #nomadic traditions and will draw competitors from some 40 countries this year.

status_message:
A number of #waterspouts appeared over #Qinghai Lake, northwest #China on Wednesday.

Passing tourists captured the unusual scene with their phones.

A waterspout is an intense columnar vortex that occurs over a body of water, caused by cold and warm air flows converging above the water surface.

Similar to #tornadoes, they are usually weaker than their land counterparts, though some have been known to throw ships into the air.
link_name: Rare waterspouts on Qinghai Lake, China

A powerful #earthquake struck #Myanmar on Wednesday 4:34pm measuring 6.8 on the #Richter scale.

At least three people were killed, while more than 185 #temples and #shrines collapsed in the ancient capital of #Bagan, a major tourist destination known as the "City of Four Million Pagodas". Some #pagodas date back to the 10th to 14th century.

The tremors were also felt in neighboring #Thailand and #India.
link_name: 6.8 Richter Myanmar  quake ruins 100s of temples.

A giant grid electrifying one of China's most remote regions 
underwent its first major overhaul this week.

The #Tibet-#Sichuan interconnection grid is the second largest after the Qinghai-Tibet grid connect
which was finished in 2011.

Workers traipsed 60 storeys above the Jinsha River to replace an insulator worn out by weather

The maintenance work is among the highest carried out with most sites at an altitude of 3,850 meters, and the highest altitude at more than 4,980 meters, nearly two years after it began official operation in November 2014.

#Indonesia may ban alcoholic drinks.

The Indonesian parliament is reviewing a blanket ban on booze nation-wide. Alcohol sales were banned in roughly 70,000 local stores last year.

The proposal, by two Islamist parties is to protect citizens. Hotel and restaurant operators think it will kill tourism.

Domestic #alcohol consumption in Indonesia is one of the world's lowest.

A total of 1,779 people have been killed in the #Philippines' war on drugs since July 1.

712 deaths were due to police while 1,067 were killed by vigilantes.

The number of extra-judicial killings worries the United Nations and other international human rights groups.

Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte said the fight against #drugs will be relentless and will be sustained.

Transcripts of the  Tokyo War Crimes Tribunal 
were released in Chinese at the #ShanghaiBookFair. 

This book contains transcripts relating to #China 
attracted hordes of readers to this year's book fair.

Its publishers hope it can give Chinese readers

Book's translator, #XiangLongwan, is the son

More books about the trials

status_message:
President of the International Olympic Committee Thomas Bach passed
the summer games' flag to Tokyo, host of the 2020 games. 

This is #Tokyo's second hosting of the #SummerOlympics.

Tokyo's bid, won three years ago, faced a series of problems
including forced redesigns to stadiums, budget issues
and allegations its official logo was plagiarized.

More than half of #Tokyo residents want spending
brought under control, according to a survey.

Despite challenges, #Japanese youths
are certainly looking forward to the mega event.
link_name: A 2020 Konichiwa for the Olympic games

status_message:
The curtains closed on 
South America's first ever #Olympics

The Olympic flag was given to #Tokyo
host of the 2020 summer games. 

Triumphal and touching moments 
punctuated the #Rio Olympics  
with China's teams drawing international attention.

The Chinese cycling teams rode to two medals,
donning helmets painted in operatic fashion,
denoting their bravery.

3-meter springboard silver medalist #HeZi, 
accepted an engagement proposal by fellow athlete #QinKai,

#FuYuanhui, shocked by her bronze medal win 
won international acclaim and respect  
for her honesty and quirkiness.

The Chinese women's volleyball team's comeback
from a loss to Serbia in preliminary rounds
to besting the Balkan nation in the finals
will go down as one of China's greatest gold medal wins.
link_name: Olympic Games a triumph for Rio
